title: Understanding the New Tax Regime 2026: Slabs, Changes & Benefits

excerpt: A deep dive into the 2026 tax changes, the increased standard deduction, and how to choose between old and new regimes.
content: The 2026 financial year has brought a shift in India’s tax landscape. With the standard deduction now increased to ₹75,000, middle-income earners are seeing better take-home pay. title: The Science of Debt: How Does an EMI Calculator Actually Work?
seo_keywords: how emi calculator works, emi formula, loan interest calculation, reducing balance method
excerpt: Ever wondered how banks calculate your monthly payments? We break down the EMI formula and why it matters.
content: Before you take a loan, you must understand the math. This post explains the standard EMI formula: $EMI = [P x r x (1+r)^n] / [(1+r)^n - 1]$. We look at how the 'Reducing Balance Method' works, why interest is front-loaded in the early years of a loan, and how small prepayments can save you lakhs in interest over time.

title: How Much EMI Is Safe? The 50/30/20 Rule Explained
seo_keywords: safe emi limit, 50-30-20 rule finance, personal loan mistakes, debt management 2026
excerpt: Don't let debt drown your savings. Learn how to use the 50/30/20 rule to decide your maximum EMI capacity.
content: Over-leveraging is a common financial trap. We explain why your total EMIs should ideally never cross 40-45% of your monthly take-home pay. Using the 50/30/20 rule (50% Needs, 30% Wants, 20% Savings), this blog helps you find the 'sweet spot' for a new car or home loan without sacrificing your financial freedom.
